title: nf-core/taxtriage pipeline parameters
description: APHL pipeline for triage classification reports

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 3 columns, and a header row. See [usage docs](https://nf-co.re/taxtriage/usage#samplesheet-input).

save_output_fastqs.description: Save all read classifications as a txt file

assembly.description: Path to an assembly file. This contains the taxid and relative genome file that can be pulled from Entrez (ncbi). If not called, it auto downloads in the pipeline and requires internet connectivity

filter.description: Path to a kraken2 database. Typically, this would be the human reads database for human-derived samples

trim.description: Trim the files beforehand with trimgalore. Illumina only samples

assembly_file_type.description: Assembly text file format. Can be a kraken2 fasta (kraken2) or the one pulled from ncbi (ncbi)

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

skip_plots.description: Skip upfront QC plotting to save time

demux.description: Run Demux on a folder of fastq files

outdir.description: Output directory full of files. Report will be generated at <PATH>/multiqc/multiqc_report.html

top_hits_count.description: Top N organisms to report per sample

blastdb.description: Blast Database (local or remote, local must be absolute path)

remove_taxids.description: Taxid numbers in double quotes ( e.g. "9606" for human). For multiple, example: "9606 2" removes human AND all Bacteria

skip_realignment.description: Dont do re-alignment post kraken2 classification
